content: g u l f o f m e x i c o © k i e r a n f o l e y 2 0 2 5 the nets were overflowing in the gulf of mexico from refuge of the roads by joni mitchell a long skinny scarf with a rustic garter stitch chevron inspired by a favorite song the scarf is worked with two strands held together the edges are slightly ruffled and uneven knit on 5mm/us8 needles with approximately 60g/280yds/260m of leftover yarns including jamieson s of shetland spindrift and some merino silk mixes if you are working with one strand of a heavier yarn allow approximately 140yds/130m dimensions approximately 4 75ins/12cm wide by 46ins/117cm gauge approximately 19sts measured on the diagonal and 22 row measured along the spine = 4ins/10cm in pattern notes the double increase abbreviated to increase is worked as follows k yo k into one stitch increasing by two stitches i worked with relatively short lengths of yarn splicing in a new color when necessary generally holding a dark and light shade together sometimes holding two darker colors together the pattern can also be worked in a more varied palette to use up more varied scraps keep the knitting quite loose for a soft flexible fabric to make a longer or shorter scarf you can make adjustments between row 121 and 148 adding or subtracting row as desired the tips of the scarf are slightly mismatched due to the asymmetrical chevron structure the picture on the right below shows both tips with the co on the right and the bobble on the left pattern row 79 k9 increase k9 21sts row 191 193 195 197 k2tog k7 increase k7 ssk co 3sts and knit 1
